mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Boorish and crass, homophobic and misogynistic, the very definition of sloppy seconds — par for the course where the present generation of male-driven, R-rated, “Hangover”-aping franchise comedies are concerned. That it somehow manages to send you out of the theater feeling tickled rather than sullied may be a mystery as impenetrable as the cosmos.

Ultimately, "2" is hit-and-run humor as hit or miss as any comedy of its ilk. If one has to sit in front of a jet spray of degradation gags, better it feel like the occasional seltzer spritz than a fire hose blast to the crotch.

The best moments in this film are the moments where it feels like they're just throwing jokes at the screen. The moments that are toughest are the ones where they try to create some sort of emotional beat, because the moment we're supposed to invest in these guys at all, the movie crumbles.
In the future, in the past, at all points along the space-time continuum, the Theory of the Teenage Male Mind throws everything out of whack.
Whether something did or didn’t happen, and the comic confusion as the future bumps into the past: those are the smart parts of a movie that is not as idiotic as it pretends to be.

The film isn’t bad, although it is somewhat repetitive. If it has plot holes, conceptual laziness and an overreliance on dumb-insult humor, the film at least seems to know it. There are lots of self-referential jokes that acknowledge its own stupidity.
Some of the gags are stupid-funny, others are just puerile, making for a hit-or-miss experience.
The difference here — aside from the fact that the jokes aren’t as funny and that John Cusack is nowhere to be found — is the lack of a motivating factor.

Corddry’s Lou was an enjoyable, over-the-top asshole in the first film, providing most of its humor, even while surrounded by an equally strong cast. However, here, he’s just a truly disgusting human being. Worse still, he’s not that funny.
The film doesn’t look like the future, or the past’s idea of the future, or anything other than a venal cash grab.
Despite some choice improvisations, we're given no running gag as endearing as the first film.
Look, the movie didn't have to cure cancer or anything. But sans the original's redemptive nostalgia or any newfound cleverness, it's just a manic, flop-sweat-drenched mess.
If Hot Tub Time Machine 2 accomplishes anything — and it really doesn't — it is that it too never manages to find a way to justify its own existence.
The boorish, juvenile Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is the proverbial turd in the Jacuzzi – you can’t pin down who’s responsible, but it’s a floater that ruins the party.
Compared with last time, the returning team of director Steve Pink and writer Josh Heald practically doodle the gang’s motivations and worse, their surroundings.
The sequel is dominated by Rob Corddry, a fearless funnyman best taken in tiny doses. The doses aren’t tiny enough and the laughs are few and far between this time in the tub.

If the undemanding silliness of the first “Hot Tub Time Machine” was your cup of comedy, then you may well enjoy another plunge in these waters. Apart from a few laughs, however, I found the experience tepid and soggy.
Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is a movie that didn't need to be made, and certainly doesn't need to be seen — not when you can rent the original and still feel good about yourself afterward.
It’s a comedy that’s so witless and unfunny and shoddily made it makes "The Hangover 2" look like "The Godfather 2."
It’s just bad. It’s boring, folks.

Given the considerable comedic talents of Rob Corddry, Craig Robinson, Adam Scott et al., and the ragged, what-the-hell charms of the original “Hot Tub Time Machine,” it’s surprising how rotten this movie is from start to finish.
Josh Heald's script takes the easy way out, ending the film with a torrent of slapdash sentimentality.
Within five minutes you’ll guess why John Cusack, not overly encumbered with big film roles these days, didn’t return for the sequel: The script is monotonous, meandering and witless.
What we end up with is a meandering mishmash of tasteless jokes and a tendency for extended non sequitur riffs.
The humor is seldom character-based: It’s more a matter of actors saying whatever outrageous thing springs to mind at that moment.
Like a hot tub itself, it looks inviting, but all too soon you've had enough.
If there was just one extended sequence that crackled with originality you could at least say it has its moments, but, truly, there’s nothing besides repeated use of swear words in lieu of wit.
Oh, for a time machine that would give me back the hour and a half I spent watching this movie.
It tries to repeat everything the original did, and winds up leaving you stone-faced and depressed. I think there were more laughs in Schindler’s List.
A flop-sweaty cash grab that gives a bad name to sequels in which key talent has jumped ship... Viewers who expected nothing from the first but were pleasantly surprised will get burned badly here.
This version of the time machine is more powerful — it’s made me go back and hate the original.

mc_user_reviews.text: yes it is true this another sequel to a movie that never even needed one, but if you go in and take this movie seriously you're going to have a bad time, just sit back and relax. i loved it.

I love being right, I really do, but when i'm wrong and I get a pleasant surprise it makes it that much sweeter. That was the case with Hot tub time machine 2. I never saw the first one, so maybe this made the experience a bit more surprising, but this movie was hilarious, I mean wicked funny. The chemistry between these three actors was special. The script was so funny, and it was so well written. I mean I think some of these one liners are going to go down in history. Essentially being a comedy film, there was a good mystery element going on at the same time. Which gave the raunchy comedy a plot with depth and substance. I was very impressed.

I was hooked in by the marketing of this movie, and had not actually seen the first one. Now, I am a huge fan and can't wait to check out the original. Funny, fun, and well acted by the comedians. Great flick worth seeing!

I'm pretty picky about movies, but I really think this one is underrated or reviewed by people who didn't actually see the whole thing.   It had funny moments all throughout the film.   Be cool and give this film and the actors a better rating.  They did a great job!
Funny and entertaining, yet not as good as the Hot tub movie. Worth the price to see but I will not buy the Blu-ray Disc. Better shows are available to see but we had a good time watching.

This movie is a bit of a mess, but I loved the first one and I think people are just demanding a lot more polish with their shi**y modern comedies.  Compared to other comedies I've seen, this was easily just as funny, fun, and cliched.  The running jokes are great, and it had even less disgusting humor than the first.  Maybe because the beginning of this movie isn't good, everyone hates the rest of it?  Who cares, I'm glad this movie came out.

Not to be cliche, but I did want to like this movie because I really enjoyed the first one and the critics have been hard n it, but the bad reviews are accurate. This movie lost touch of what the first one was, and a lot of the characters aren't who they were before. Granted that is part of the plot in the end with different dimensions having different Lou's, but Hot Tub Time Machine 2 was almost entirely dick jokes, and a crappy murder mystery.

Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is one of the circles of h*ll just really painful to be in, unpleasant, and you want nothing more to get out. You’ll be asking yourself why are you here and what I did I do to deserve this. The sad part about this film is that some of the satire humor works and the cast is enjoyable to watch but all that is buried under all the stuff that doesn’t work. The story of the film lacks any heart and interesting ideas using time travel just for a ton of references to movies that are way better than this one; penis jokes along with other types of gross out humor; and scenes that revolting to watch. While sequels tend to suck the idea of going into the future could lead to some good satire but rather than explore that they just get lazy and do a bunch of laughs. I could criticize this film for ripping off Back to the Future Part II but those are too different genres and several gags in this film do work and had the film been smarter about its humor and hadn’t hit the lazy button it could’ve been entertaining. Instead this film does all the lazy tropes you’d expect of a terrible sequel. I would recommend avoiding this film at all costs. If you need to see this film either watch it illegally online or just wait for it to come out on DVD. You’ll hate it a lot less if you are watching it of your own free will and weren’t forced to see it in theaters like I was. If I had a hot tub I’d go back in time and make sure I never went and saw this movie or prevented it from being made.

One of the two worst movies I've seen in 14 - 15, the other being Sex Tape. But Sex Tape beats it out because I at least laughed twice in that one.  This?  I laughed once - at a line that nobody else in the theater made a sound on.  I loved the first movie - this second one flat out sucked.  I was actively looking forward to coming home to watch something on my DVR.  That's sad.  So is this movie.

Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is a gross, horribly written and badly unfunny sequel to the original. It perpously uses elements and jokes from other movies and it's predecessor and shoves them in a badly written script. I really thought that this adventure in time would feature some cool things, like we haven't seen a raunchy science fiction comedy in a while. But no, the movie falls so low that you will be tired to even hear Rob Codrrey talk again, and that is saying something. HTTM2 is a bad movie, it isnt a comedy, it is a mashup of dick jokes, boobs and unflattering comedy. Does that mean this isn't even a movie?

So far the funniest movie I saw this year. I don't understand why there are a lot of negative reviews. I laugh so much that I almost pissed my pants. It was a very great unique movie, without any of that comedy rust jokes. Very creative piece of material. Don't mind the negative reviews it is an animal comedy, if you like the first one you will love this sequel.

Who in the world want to make a sequel to Hot Tub Time Machine? I love the first movie, but where's John Cusack in Part 2? This is one of the worst sequel of the year and that's a good thing. Thank goodness I skipped to this waste and see Kingsman instead. I love the entire cast (even though Lisa Loeb made a cameo), but the rest of the movie is just awfully bad. The script is lame, same humor jokes but little less fun, and I don't know what's worst, this or last year's Sex Tape. I guess HTTM2 is just not as bad as I think, but it's the sequel nobody wanted or asked for.

One of the worst movies I've ever seen. What a sad mess. I grimaced the entire time and think I half chuckled once to see if I was still alive. I loved the first one and my bad for not looking at a single review before I bought a ticket. I went to a 7:45 showing with my 21 yr old son (a bonding night, LOL) and there were only 2 other people in the theater. I'm actually surprised it got an MC rating as high as 31. I've watched Master of Disguises (got a 12) and that seems like a comedy classic next to this one.

Tough to say this but without straight man Cuzak from the first movie, this movie is off the railing pretty quick. Another demonstration that sequels rarely work. As with the previous, I did like the flashback/reminising of the past-including the music and dress. But after 45 minutes, it was enough.
This movie is a big drag with a bunch of cringe worthy attempts at humor. HTTM 2 should have gone straight to Dvd. The first movie was very good, but comedy sequals seem to usually be bad.

Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is half-assed and terribly written. I wasn't even really a big fan of the first film but I watched this movie anyway and it turned out to be a waste of my time. First off the series loses on John Cusack who is really the only person that had the ability to lead the cast. I couldn't stand Rob Corddry in this film, he was just such a douchebag. I was drawn to this movie because of Adam Scott but even he didn't impress me. Really Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is just full of a bunch of comedy actors that have suffered in the supporting cast for years and now we know why. Please don't waste your time.

Its really crude and that's what I want to see in a comedy movie with a group of guys. Like the Hangover that type of movie or Horrible Bosses. This movie is hilarious. But there are some scenes that feel like they shouldn't been there. For me this is a great late night type movie. If you don't get offended by vulgar jokes than this is for you.

I went to the theater to see a different movie but walked out of it because it was bad.  I then decided to give HTTM2 a try despite its poor reviews.  It was much worse.  I was the only person in the theater, and for good reason.  I spent more time watching the previews than the movie.

There was no reason for a sequel to Hot Tub Time Machine. There wasn't any conceivable place for the plot to go. This movie just proves that. There isn't really a plot here at all. Just a stupid concept that is lifelessly dragged around so that the writer(s) could try to make a few jokes and cash in on the first movie. None of that would have mattered though had this movie been funny. It's not.
If only I could get my hands on the machine of the title, so I could go back in time and unlatch this monstrosity. The first film had a certain charm, this certainly hasn't!
Another really poor sequel that fails to deliver in almost every way the original did.  Put aside that the plot is convoluted this film is just not funny.  D

Wow, what a mess of a film. Strangely it wasn't as bad as I thought it could be... until the very end. Then it was a whole lot worse. Overall messy editing/acting and plot. It felt like a rushed cocaine fuelled cash-cow that failed horribly.
Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is yet another uninspired comedy sequel that only happened because the first made money. You'll spend most of the time thinking "why am I watching this ?."

Worst movie ever....the only time I laughed was during the preview for Ted..if I can save someone the admission price to this steaming pile of crap I'll have done my bit to help mankind. Seriously save your money!
"You're a **** Nerd and No One Likes You". Okay I got to admit that's the only thing funny in this whole movie.
What a total waste of time this movie was...
Hot Tub Time Machine 2 does have its moments but few and far between. It is basically a more mean-spirited version of its predecessor with none of the heart and charm.
Hot Tub Time Machine 2 is the film equivalent of an internet troll.
Landing in a wrong timeline!

Those of you who where hoping for a good sequel to the original Hot Tub Time Machine will be very disappointed. Hot Tube 2 picks up where the first one left off, They are all rich and taking advantage of there knowledge of the future as much as they can. This does make for a few funny scenes but then shorty after that the story Shifts to being about finding who shot Lou in the Dick..This is where I find the movie starts to fall apart, Jokes start becoming weird or just overdone, It just starts to feel immature and not anywhere similar to the original. The acting is good from the 4 main characters but it makes it that much worse that the writers couldn't come up with better material for the characters, especially with Hot Tub 1 to work off of. It is kind of sad when the trailer for you movie looks better then it really is, and sadly all the parts from said trailer are in the end credits.

The one and only thing I like about HTTM2 is that mirror scene. The other is **** But I did like the idea of the future but the movie fails at being funny and to entertain the audience. Definitely worth a wait on Netflix or Redbox. And if they dare to make a third movie than I'm out.

Seriously I loved hot tub time machine and hot tub time machine 2, the same way. It's seriously my favorite movies. Last night when I watched part 2 omg I was laughing so hard. It's a really great movie I'm going to make my friends and family watch them with me. I can watch these movies over and over again and would not ever get tired of them. Part 2 made me laugh a lot more then pt. 1. I enjoyed this movie to the point where I want to watch it again already. Please make a part 3!! These reviews are underrated.
